snippet: The University of Alabama-Birmingham said it would terminate its football program, becoming the first university in the top college sports tier to do so in nearly 20 years.
abstract: University of Alabama-Birmingham says it is ending its football program, becoming the first university in the top college sports tier to do so in nearly 20 years; move is most apparent sign yet that officials are ruminating on radical choices in face of rising financial strains.

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and ZACH SCHONBRUN

lead_paragraph: The University of Alabama-Birmingham said it would terminate its football program, becoming the first university in the top college sports tier to do so in nearly 20 years.

headline.main: It’s a Game of Spiraling Costs, So a College Tosses Out Football
headline.print_headline: It’s a Game of Spiraling Costs, So a College Tosses Out Football
